definitions.definition: to move, or make somebody/something move, around quickly in a circle or in a particular direction

examples.text: She whirled around to face him.
They ducked to avoid the whirling blades of the helicopter.
Tom whirled her across the dance floor.
He grasped her wrist and whirled her back to face him.
He whirled her around the dance floor.
She whirled round and round, flinging out her arms.
The gulls were whirling and shrieking in the sky above.

definitions.definition: if your mind, thoughts, etc. whirl, you feel confused and excited and cannot think clearly

examples.text: I couldn't sleep—my mind was whirling from all that had happened.
So many thoughts whirled around in her mind.

wordOrigin: Middle English: the verb probably from Old Norse hvirfla ‘turn about’; the noun partly from Middle Low German, Middle Dutch wervel ‘spindle’, or from Old Norse hvirfill ‘circle’, from a Germanic base meaning ‘rotate’.
